entry.summary:
Author: battinscnz

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,751Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 198

Summary: Bruce Wayne is no stranger to the spotlightâ€”or the shadows it casts. Reclusive, haunted by tragedy, and heir to a name that carries more weight than comfort, he now faces something far more personal than public scrutiny: a stalker. The letters arrive like clockworkâ€”taunting, obsessive, familiar. And with Halloween approachingâ€”the anniversary of his parents' deathâ€”the tension coils tighter.Clark Kent is a disciplined, quietly intense MMA-trained security specialist, brought in under General Sam Laneâ€™s orders to keep Bruce safe. He expects a job. He doesnâ€™t expect the gothic cold of Wayne Manor, the brooding silence of its only resident, or the unsettling depth of what Bruce refuses to say out loud.But as danger creeps closer, and the mystery surrounding the stalker sharpens, Bruce and Clark are forced into uncomfortable proximity. What begins as resistance slowly becomes something deeperâ€”something fragile and real.

Author: azulyra_moon

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,308Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 4

Summary: The Wayne family was predominantly successful in many ways; being strong, healthy, and all absolutely handsome from a supposedly upstanding background with no means for mistakes, weakness, or forgiveness. â€œHaving flaws or petty arguments puts a target on your back. Fix it, keep quiet, or die,â€ said their very blunt but importantly, hypocritical father. So, masks stayed on, even within the Wayne Manor.To the protÃ©gÃ©â€™s in the Wayne familyâ€” the Kryptonian, Man of Steel, Boy-Scout, Big Blue, or simply â€˜Supesâ€™ was known an associate of the Justice League that their father tolerated. Little do they know it is all complicated than that behind closed doors with Bruceâ€™s relationship with the strongest man on earth. Yet, two fights occur, and someone died. In the end, will love fix all?Easy intro: After a rough introduction and even failing mending relationship between Worldâ€™s Finest, a member of the Wayne family passes away. Clark Kent, now having a wavering heart of gold, feels a inclination to help hand to the family despite the never-ending rocky road relationship between him and with the Dark Knight, also known as Bruce Wayne, the playboy multi-billionaire, AKA his miscommunicated ex-fling once upon a time.

Summary: â€œNo comment.â€â€œYou donâ€™t know what I was going to ask,â€ Clark said with a hint of a smile. â€œMaybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.â€Bruce gave him a flat look.â€œOr maybe I think I can help.â€â€œWith a case of vandalism?â€Clark stepped in front of him. â€œItâ€™s not vandalism and you know it, detective.â€â€œAnd what makes you say that?â€â€œIf it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldnâ€™t claim there were seventeen missing kids. Thatâ€™s public outcry.â€â€œIs that so?â€â€œThat and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but thereâ€™s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?â€Â Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, heâ€™ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.
